column1: Coralville is a city in Johnson County
column3: United States. It is a suburb of Iowa City and part of the Iowa City Metropolitan Statistical Area. The population was 18

column1: Coralville is the location of the Edgewater Park Site
column3: 800-year-old archaeological site along the Iowa River. Edgewater is the oldest site in Iowa with evidence of domesticated plant use.

column1: Coralville incorporated as a city on June 1
column2: 1857. The city's name is derived from the fossils that are found in the limestone along the Iowa River. In 1864
column5: gave a lecture at the nearby University of Iowa titled “The Coral Reefs of Iowa City”. During the lecture
column6: he presented local samples of fossilized Devonian period coral. The lecture was well received and helped raise public interest in the local fossils. In 1866
column7: more corals were discovered at the site of a new mill
column8: inspiring the citizens of the area to name the settlement "Coralville". The first mill at Coralville was built in 1844
column9: and in the years that followed
column10: a number of mills were powered by the Coralville mill dam along the Iowa River
column11: but all of the mills had closed by 1900
column12: except for a low-head hydroelectric plant that remained in operation until the mid 20th century.

column1: Coralville is also the location where some 1300 Mormon immigrants stopped to make camp in their migration of 1856 after having traveled west by rail to Iowa City
column2: which was the westernmost rail terminus at the time.  They built handcarts out of native woods during their encampment so that an adult could haul a 600–700 pound load and cover about 15 miles per day on foot in their continuing trek to Salt Lake City. A historical marker commemorating the Mormon Handcart Brigade was erected in 1936 by the Iowa Society DAR
column3: with members of the Pilgrim Chapter present.  Originally placed just south of 5th Street and west of 10th Street
column4: it was moved in 1998 to S. T. Morrison Park and rededicated by the Nathaniel Fellows Chapter
column5: placed near the entrance and pond. Today
column6: the Mormon Handcart Park and Nature Preserve commemorates the site.  There is also a street
column8: named for the Mormons who went through that area.

column2: Coralville began to grow as many university students began to make their homes there. It had only 433 people in 1940
column3: but by 1970 Coralville's population had jumped to 6
column4: 130. The construction of Interstate 80 in the 1960s brought several motels

column2: the independent school district of Coralville was annexed by the Iowa City Community School District. Junior and senior high school students rode buses into Iowa City. Elementary (K-6) students attended Central Elementary School. Kirkwood Elementary school was opened in the fall of 1964
column3: giving the growing town its second school. By the fall of 1968
column4: all high school students from Coralville began attending the newly opened West High School. In 1971
column5: the district built Northwest Junior High on property just to the south of Kirkwood Elementary
column6: which then began handling seventh and eighth graders who lived west of the Iowa River. In 1997

column2: the United States Army Corps of Engineers completed Coralville Dam along the Iowa River
column3: four miles (6 km) north of the city
column4: creating Coralville Lake. Except for the Great Flood of 1993 and the Great Iowa flood of 2008
column5: the dam has helped prevent serious flooding in the city. From June through August 1993
column6: all three of Coralville's main transportation links with Iowa City were submerged. The economic impact that year was severe
column7: but the city had almost fully recovered within two years. The 2008 flood proved to be more costly as the Iowa River surpassed the 1993 record crest at over 31.5 feet (9.6 m).

column1: The First Methodist Church was built in 1963 to the designs by architect Thomas Patrick Reilly of Crites & McConnell
column6: the Coral Ridge Mall opened with more than 100 stores
column7: then the largest shopping center in the state. Around that time a "city center" area was created along the U.S. Route 6 "strip" near its intersection with 12th Avenue. Coral Ridge Mall's opening would usher in a new era of retail development as big box stores such as Wal-Mart
column9: and Lowe's opened in the area surrounding the mall.  This has helped boost taxable sales in Coralville from $155.3 million in 1996 to $549.7 million in 2006.Xtream Arena
column12: is projected to open in 2020 in the city's Iowa River Landing neighborhood.

column1: Coralville is located in Johnson County at 41°41′18″N 91°35′12″W (41.688215
column2: -91.586764).According to the United States Census Bureau
column3: the city has a total area of 12.05 square miles (31.21 km2)
column4: of which 12.01 square miles (31.11 km2) is land and 0.04 square miles (0.10 km2) is water.The Iowa River runs along the east edge of Coralville and forms part of the boundary with Iowa City. Interstate 80 runs east–west through Coralville
column5: and most of the city's newer housing subdivisions are located north of I-80. U.S. Route 6 runs along Coralville's south edge
column8: and Iowa Highway 27 (the Avenue of the Saints) run along the city's west edge. The cloverleaf interchange of I-80 and I-380/U.S. 218/Iowa 27 is divided between the city limits of Coralville and neighboring Tiffin after recent annexations.
